Quotes: A woman has the age she deserves.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: Look for the woman in the dress. If there is no woman, there is no dress.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: Somebody just back of you while you are fishing is as bad as someone looking over your shoulder while you write a letter to your girl.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: There is many a virtuous woman weary of her trade.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: For the woman, the man is a means: the end is always the child.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The test of a man or woman's breeding is how they behave in a quarrel.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The trouble with her is that she lacks the power of conversation but not the power of speech.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: It is a common enough case, that of a man being suddenly captivated by a woman nearly the opposite of his ideal.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Every woman is supposed to have the same set of motives, or else to be a monster.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: And when a woman's will is as strong as the man's who wants to govern her, half her strength must be concealment.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Wives are people who feel they don't dance enough.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: A man's only as old as the woman he feels.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: A woman is an occasional pleasure but a cigar is always a smoke.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: A man is a poor creature compared to a woman.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: A husband who submits to his wife's yoke is justly held an object of ridicule. A woman's influence ought to be entirely concealed.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: A young bride is like a plucked flower;but a guilty wife is like a flower that had been walked over.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: What a strange thing man is;and what a stranger thing woman.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: The charms of the passing woman are generally in direct proportion to the swiftness of her passing.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: Ah! how annoying that the law doesn't allow a woman to change husbands just as one does shirts.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: No woman should ever be quite accurate about her age. It looks so calculating.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Woman begins by resisting a man's advances and ends by blocking his retreat.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: When a woman is talking to you, listen to what she says with her eyes.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: No one knows like a woman how to say things which are at once gentle and deep.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Blessed be Providence which has given to each his toy: the doll to the child, the child to the woman, the woman to the man, the man to the devil!
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Indeed, I would venture to guess that Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: As a woman I have no country. As a woman my country is the whole world.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: It is fatal to be a man or woman pure and simple: one must be a woman manly, or a man womanly.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: There can be no two opinions as to what a highbrow is. He is the man or woman of thoroughbred intelligence who rides his mind at a gallop across country in pursuit of an idea.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: I would venture to guess that Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: There was never yet fair woman but she made mouths in a glass.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Teach not thy lip such scorn, for it was made For kissing, lady, not for such contempt.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Maids want nothing but husbands, and when they have them, they want everything.
Author: William Shakespeare
